results.title: Safety in your hands
results.creator_credit: Edwin Scragg, Jill Robb, John Fitzgerald and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
This 1974 film examines the responsibility of each worker for their own safety in the workplace. The film focuses particularly on protection of hands and eyes in industrial settings, showing a variety of machines operated by people. It demonstrates how untidiness, inattention, overconfidence and failure to use safety precautions such as safety glasses when operating these machines can lead to accidents. Footage of industrial workplaces is interspersed with footage of everyday accidents similarly caused by mess, distraction and overconfidence.

Produced by the South Australian Film Corporation for the South Australian Department of Labour and Industry.

The colour is faded throughout the film.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Flamingo Park
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Frazer, Clytie Jessop, Women's Film Fund (Australia) and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Shows the works of two artistic and talented Australian fashion designers. Jenny Kee’s colourful designs are inspired by the tones of the bush, birds and flora, whilst Linda Jackson’s inspiration comes from the ocean and the sealife. Jenny’s designs are made up into outstandingly colourful handknitted garments, whilst Linda uses chiffons, cottons and appliqued designs.

results.title: Islands in the sky
results.creator_credit: Klaus Jaritz, Dietmar Fill, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the summer wildflowers in Kosciusko National Park. Discusses adaptation of the plants to the hostile environment and includes an alpine herb field, ferns and bogs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Klaus Jaritz, Dietmar Fill, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Who Does the Sentence?
results.creator_credit: Mark Laidler, Peter Johnson, Coburg State College and Victorian association for the care and resettlement of offenders
results.brief_description: When a person is taken into custody, the family of the offender serve “a sentence” of another kind. The Victorian Association for the Care and Rehabilitation of Offenders (VACRO) tries to help these families in its own individual fashion. The film is noted for scenes actually filmed in Pentridge

results.title: Great coastal dune show
results.creator_credit: Andrew Prowse, Ron Saunders, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the Department of Environment, Housing and Community Developments, this film adopts a satirical approach to the needs of a coastal dwelling nation like Australia actively trying to preserve coastline ecosystems. The film is short and its “message” is sharp: building on sand is insecure in more than one sense. Largely because of the humorous approach taken by the scriptwriter, the future impact of interference with dune communities should be felt by all audiences but, in particular, those who see the film in the classroom.

results.title: Thing of Beauty
results.brief_description: The restoration of the interior of Parliament House, Melbourne is a time-consuming and delicate process-making replicas and replacing the Victorian baroque moulded plaster decorations, applying gold-leaf less than a thousandth of an inch thick, retouching the highlights of the mouldings and repainting the walls and surrounds with the original sky-blue - but the result is both eccentric and splendid

results.title: The Living forest
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Tom Morrison, Ken J. Widdowson and Victorian Forests Commission
results.brief_description: A film which shows how man is making heavy demands on the earth’s remaining forests. A detailed study is made of the ecology of a eucalypt forest and the many plants and animals which make up the forest environment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Corke, Tom Morrison, Ken J. Widdowson and Victorian Forests Commission

results.title: Zoo
results.creator_credit: David Hughes, Gerry Hudson, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: This film was made at the Melbourne Zoo and, without commentary, shows the activities - particularly eating - of birds in the air and animals on land and in water. There are some interesting close-ups of parts of animals, eg. the texture of the skin of a hippo and the back of an eagle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Hughes, Gerry Hudson, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre

results.title: You'd have to be mad to like opera
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Karl McPhee, Gil Brealey and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian Opera”.
Explores the personality of opera singer Isobel Buchanan, and gives an insight into her life as an opera singer. She is seen in a number of situations which show the wide range of activities and disciplines which go towards the making of an opera. Particular emphasis is placed on rehearsal and actual performance of the opera ‘Don Pasquale’. Production manager, Roy Bissell; director, script, Karl McPhee; editor, Ian Walker; sound, Rodney Simmons; photographer, Andrew Fraser.

results.title: You and Your Vote
results.creator_credit: Douglas White, Loch Townsend, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: In an attempt to overcome informal voting in Senate elections, an account is given of the work of the Electoral Office and the correct way in which a vote should be recorded.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Douglas White, Loch Townsend, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
